text_en: Mental Health Gap Action Programme (mhGAP) guideline for mental, neurological and substance use disorders 3.2 Anxiety (ANX) ANX1. In adults with anxiety disorders (excluding social anxiety disorder and specific phobias), are antidepressants (tricyclic antidepressants [TCAs] and selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors [SSRIs]) effective and safe compared with treatment as usual, waitlist, no treatment, or alternative psychological or pharmacological treatments? Recommendation (new): Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) should be considered for adults with panic disorder. If SSRIs are not available, consider offering tricyclic antidepressants (TCAs). SSRIs should be considered for adults with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
